name: WordPress White Label
author: Kerry James

sections.description:
This is a beta, please use at own risk, White label WordPress with a plugin instead of hacking the WordPress core.

This plugin is perfect for those who use WordPress as a development environment but would like to hide the fact WordPress has been used.
sections.installation:
This section describes how to install the plugin and get it working.

  1. Upload ‘wordpress-white-label’ to the ‘/wp-content/plugins/’ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. Use through the ‘White Label’ menu in WordPress
sections.changelog:
0.2.1 Beta

  • Fixed saving issue.

0.2 Beta

  • Added cleanup tags.
  • User update nag screen deleted.
  • Overide help context menus.
  • Extensive capabilities manager.

0.1.4 Beta

  • Added CSS rules, this allows you to use your own CSS for the admin panel.

0.1.3 Beta

  • Error reporting, allows users to email us if there is a problem.

0.1.2 Beta

  • Page rendering issue, now fixed but this plugin is beta so be warned it may render WordPress useless.

0.1.1 Beta

  • Some fixes added for document rendering, this fixes any replaces missed in the document.

0.1 Beta

  • Initial beta release.
